cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning NW toward the central Gulf Coast (near the Mississippi-Alabama border), and inland toward the lower Mississippi Valley/Oklahoma late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border; Storm Surge Watch west of Shell Beach LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of the Mississippi-Alabama border to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Shell Beach LA to Mississippi-Alabama border; Tropical Storm Warning Okaloosa-Walton County Line FL westward to east of Morgan City LA (including Lakes Pontchartrain and Maurepas) and South Florida/Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and peninsula, eastern Gulf of Mexico, central Gulf Coast from Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle; minor surge potential to the Louisiana-Texas border
weather_observation.wind: Low (7%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible late Wednesday into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Texas-Louisiana border, including the Port Arthur area
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain to Port Arthur Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Marginal threat of isolated brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands if the track shifts west, but overall risk is low
